fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JSM Connect provides a \{servicedesk.requestTypeId} context parameter, but when used, it is intermittently blank.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app that contributes a _Create request view_ or _Request details view_ which is mapped to a URL that includes the [context parameter|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/context-parameters/] \{servicedesk.requestTypeId} in the query part of the URL.
 # Open the app's _Create request view_ or _Request details view_.
 # Inspect the app iframe's URL.

h3. Expected Results

The app iframe URL is completed with the filled in value for the \{servicedesk.requestTypeId} context parameter.
h3. Actual Results

Intermittently, the app iframe URL omits the value for the \{servicedesk.requestTypeId} context parameter.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: requestTypeId context parameter is intermittently omitted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Hi team, the Incoming Call Routing isn't supported in the JSM-Subordinated Opsgenie but there is still an Analytics page for that, which delivers the incorrect expectation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to your JSM-subordinated Opsgenie and access the Analytics tab to see if Incoming Call Routing is showing up.

h3. Expected Results

The Analytics for Incoming Call Routing shouldn't be accessible under the Analytics page of a JSM-subordinated Opsgenie.
h3. Actual Results

The Analytics for Incoming Call Routing is still accessible under the Analytics page of a JSM-subordinated Opsgenie.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Remove the Incoming Call Routing Analytics page as this feature isn't supported on JSM-subordinated Opsgenie

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the Customer Portal, the *Requests* page allows admins to determine the fields to be displayed, however, it does not allow the user to save the arrangement. It will return to default once the page is refreshed.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to save the arrangement of request portal fields
fields.summary: Add the ability to retain/save the arrangement of request portal fields

fields.description:
Currently, you can share a Page directly to an anchor link by adding it at the end of the URL, like so:

* instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/{{SPACEKEY}}/pages/{{page-id}}#AnchorName

However, that does not work for the Knowledge Base view, so if you use:

* instance.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/{{portal-id}}/article/{{page-id}}#AnchorName

You will be redirected to

* instance.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/AnchorName

And an error will be shown.

It'd be beneficial to be able to send Anchor Links on the Knowledge Base just like we can for Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence anchor links URL tags to work on the knowledge base as well

fields.description:
Currently, customer notifications are not shown on the bell icon notification area on the top-right corner of the screen for users with Jira Software or Jira Core licenses that have internal access to Jira.

It would be beneficial for those users to have a centralized space for their customer notifications on JSM projects and internal notifications on Business/Software proejcts.
fields.summary: Customer Notifications should appear on the "Bell Icon" Notification area for licensed users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to browse new filters in the "Asset" custom field, newly created Insight objects are not synced to the asset field. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Create a new Asset type configuration in Insight|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSCLOUD/How+to+add+an+asset+type+configuration]
# In Jira create a new custom field of type *Asset* 
# Edit the custom field context to edit the filters
# Also for an existing asset type configuration already linked to an Asset custom field, create a new object at the Insight end and then try to browse the new object in the asset filed in the Jira issue view

h3. Expected Results
Step3: Able to browse the newly created asset type configuration under the *Filters* section while modifying the custom field context

Step4: Able to browse newly created objects

h3. Actual Results
Step3: Not able to browse the newly created asset type configuration under the *Filters* section. The below endpoint returns an outdated list of filters from Insight:
{noformat}
Request URL: https://<yourSite>.atlassian.net/rest/assetapi/asset/type
{noformat}

Step4: not able to browse newly created objects

h3. Notes
Any newly created asset type configuration is reflected in the filter section. Any deleted asset type configuration should not appear in the filter list.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Not able to browse new filters in "Asset" custom field and newly created Insight objects are not synced to the Asset field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Opsgenie standalone has the ability to send a *Weekly account summary* to users, but this feature is not available for Opsgenie sites that came (or were merged) with the JSM product.

 !Screenshot_03-04 17.47.31_JLoC7O.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add the ability to receive "Weekly account summary"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A user without a JSM license but with *Administer Jira* global permission can't create an IT Service management project. Though the user is able to create projects with other JSM templates.
{quote}Project not created.
 For some reason the magic didn't happen"
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Assign a user with Administer Jira global permission by adding the user to the jira-administrator group
 # Do not provide the user with a JSM license
 # Impersonate the user and try to create an ITSM project

h3. Expected Results

The Jira administrator should be able to create an ITSM project
h3. Actual Results

The Jira administrator receives an error when trying to create an ITSM project:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Provide the user with a JSM license temporarily
fields.summary: User without JSM license but with Administer Jira permission cannot create ITSM project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

Currently, if the *Affected services* field is added to the portal only the licensed users(Agents/Admins) are able to view and select options in this field.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Extend this feature for portal customer accounts as well.
fields.summary: Allow the use of Affected Services field on the portal for portal-only accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Long article titles will break the widget view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an article with a title long enough to use 2 text lines
 # Access the article using the widget.

h3. Expected Results

The title is correctly displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The title breaks the view.

!print.png!
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Titles of KB articles are not correctly displayed in the widget if they use more than 1 line

fields.description:
Customer requests to an ability to customize the transition Icons on the customer portal. The reason being we seen the same icon used the different transition states showing the same icon as we can see in the screenshot.

!image-2021-03-03-16-39-34-058.png!

Here customer prefers to have the flexibility of changing (SVG) aka icon for the transitions so that users can differentiate it better.
fields.summary: Ability to customise the transition Icons on Customer portal

fields.description:
Hi,

Insight discovery is only used with a scan tool. Is there any api integration for vmware Vrealize in the pipeline ?
fields.summary: Insight discovery api integration with Vrealize?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When sending an email that contains an attachment with a long Japanese file name to JSM, the error occurs and the request is not created.

The error is as follows:
{code}
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255)
{code}

For example, Japanese don't feel that the file name "これはリクエストに取り込めない長い名前の添付ファイルの例です_修正版.pptx" is too long, but the error occurs if you send an email with this file. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable email request in JSM project
 # Send an email with "これはリクエストに取り込めない長い名前の添付ファイルの例です_修正版.pptx" as attachment to the email request 


h3. Expected Results
The email is processed and created as a request with the attachment

h3. Actual Results
The error occurs and the request is not created.

h3. Workaround
Use alphabets for file name, or rename the file to something shorter
fields.summary: Unable to raise a request by email with an attachment that has a long Japanese filename

fields.description:
When an automated action is executed by the user 'Automation for Jira', customer notifications and Jira automation rules won't be triggered.
h3. Steps to Reproduce (example)
 # Enable the 'Participant added' customer notification
 # Create an automation rule in Automation for Jira
 ** Trigger: Issue created
 ** Action: Edit issue (add a user in the field Request participants)
 # Create an issue
 # Check the issue history and note the change made in the request participants by user 'Automation for Jira'
 !print.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The participant set in the rule will be added to the Request Participants and the 'Participant added' customer notification will be sent to the participant.
h3. Actual Results

The user is correctly added to the Request participants, however, the customer notification is not triggered. The participants receive notifications of actions made by other users correctly.
h3. Workaround

Select another user to execute automation actions.
fields.summary: Actions performed by user “Automation for Jira” won’t trigger Customer Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

SLAs that should stop on assignees' conditions will not stop if the *Issue Assigned* (System) event is configured in the project's workflow.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure an SLA that stops on the "*Assignee Changed*" condition.
 # Edit a transition of your workflow, and change the "Fire event" post-function, replacing the regular "Generic Event" with the "*Issue Assigned* (System)" event.
 # Also, add a transition screen to set the assignee.
 # Save and publish your workflow.
 # Create a new ticket, set the assignee while you make the modified transition.

h3. Expected Results

The ticket has the SLA stopped
h3. Actual Results

The SLA will not stop, however, updating the assignee to a new one will stop the SLA.
h3. Workaround

Use the default *Generic Event* instead.
fields.summary: SLAs do not stop on Assignees' conditions if the workflow uses an Issue Assigned (System) event

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customer portal UI always shows summary for a submitted request, even when the summary field is made a hidden field. The equivalent REST API call, GET /rest/servicedeskapi/request/issueIdOrKey, does not act consistently with the UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Given:

 # Go to a Project -> Project settings -> Request types ->  click any of your request types
 # Go to the tab "Request form"
 # Scroll to the section "Visible fields". Find the field which is mapped to the Summary field (normally this is the first one in the list)
 # Click "Hide"
 # A pop-up appears which asks you to set a preset value
 # Log in as a JSD customer to the corresponding issue
 # Start a new request for the appropriate type (matching what admin would have changed from step 1). The summary field is not shown.
 # Finish the request and see the completed request in the customer portal. The summary field is shown. Note the request Key.

Then:
 # Now execute the equivalent API request: GET /rest/servicedeskapi/request/{Key}

h3. Expected Results

The API returns the following, consistent with the UI:

{code:json}
{
  ...
 "requestFieldValues": [
    {
      "fieldId": "summary",
      "label": "What do you need?",
      "value": "Request JSD help via REST"
    },
    ...
  ],
  ...
}
{code}


h3. Actual Results

The summary field is missing in the response.

h3. Workaround

Some API clients (Connect Apps) may be able to follow the jiraRest URL to obtain the summary from the underlying issue using the platform API.
fields.summary: GET /rest/servicedeskapi/request/{issueIdOrKey} does not return hidden summary

fields.description:
Currently, you can only set an issue type while setting up issue creation through an alert via Opsgenie. Any such created issues don't show up in the queues because they don't have a valid request type.

The suggestion is to provide the ability to choose a valid request type as well in the integration configuration in Opsgenie.
h3. Workaround

A legacy automation rule like this can set a valid request type when an issue is created through the Opsgenie alert.

!Screen Shot 2021-03-01 at 3.44.42 pm.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to set the request type when issue is created through an Opsgenie alert

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to categorise the same article in two different projects, the article becomes uncategorized.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link the same confluence space to two Service desk projects
 # Add an article *X* to the category *A* in project *A*
 # Add the same article *X* to the category *B* in project *B*
 # The article in project *A* becomes uncategorised 
 # This happens only when you perform these actions from the All Articles Category.  it works as expected when you update the category from within the Category section itself.

[^Screen Recording 2021-03-01 at 7.30.10 PM.mov]
h3. Expected Results

Articles remain categorised in each project
h3. Actual Results

Article becomes uncategorised when added to a category in a different project
h3. Workaround

You could perform the same actions from within the *Category* sections instead of under *All articles* section.
 # Go to each category
 # Click on Add articles
fields.summary: Unable to categorise the same articles in two different projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Same issue on the new issue view shows as approved but on portal shows one completed approval and one pending approval, and the issue status is not in pending approval status

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Config a workflow that allows issue to transition to other status other then just approval/decline
# Create an issue and transition it to the approval workflow
# Transition the issue to other status other than approval/decline so it will leave a pending approval
# Transition the issue back to waiting for approval status
# Now complete the approval flow by approve the issue

h3. Expected Results
# This new issue view should be shown as approved on the issue view(via comment)
# Portal issue view should show the issue with only one completed approval
# Portal request filter filter by `waiting for my approval` shouldn't return this ticket for people in the approver list

h3. Actual Results
# New issue view behaves correctly by only showing the completed approval in comments
# Portal issue view still show pending approval
# Portal request filter filter by `waiting for my approval` still return the ticket even though the issue is not waiting for approval


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Approval with status does not match current issue status still shows up on portal issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The value of the Affected Services field doesn't appear in the search results when the List View is selected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a change request and fill the Affected Services field
 # Perform an advanced search > click on 'Views' and select *List View*
 # Click on *Columns* and add 'Affected Services'

h3. Expected Results

The Affected Services column will display the field value
h3. Actual Results

The column is successfully added but the value is not displayed.

!print.png|thumbnail!

 

If you change the view to *Detail View* you can see the field value.

!print2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Search results in List View won't display value of Affected Services
Public or Private parameter for Comments in JSON Importer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Ability to send email from Jira Service Management to an external address within the ticket.

Use-case example: 
 The customer creates a ticket and it is handled by a local agent. - the agent sees that the problem is a hardware issue and needs to contact the hardware vendor. 
 now the agent wants to send an email to the hardware vendor from the service desk so that he can keep all the info/communication tied to the ticket. 
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great to have the functionality for agents/administrators to be able to send an email to external emails(Third-party vendors) within the issue. Similar to the email thread functionality. 

[|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.metainf.jira.plugin.emailissue/overview]
fields.summary: Ability to send email from Jira Service Management to external address within the ticket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there are no documentation about what are the recommended settings in other mail client , for example O365 to connect to JSM email request.

h3. Suggested Solution
Even though the mail client are not supported by Atlassian Support , it will be best to have a documentation for it.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Create a documetation about the recommended settings for O365 to connect with JSM

fields.description:
As a customer, I want to:
* Track the progress of my requests
* Create new requests
* Comment on my requests
* Upload a file or photo
* Search and read knowledge base articles

Customers are any users who are submitting requests to a service desk project. These can be internal users, external customers or external clients or partners.
fields.summary: As a customer, I want to use the Customer Portal on a native mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The portal doesn't display a list of suggested articles when a user starts typing in the summary/description field
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link a confluence space to a next-gen JSM project
 # Go to the portal and start typing in the Request Form
 # No articles are suggested despite having the keywords

h3. Expected Results

The portal displays suggested articles
!Screenshot 2021-02-26 at 4.14.52 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The portal doesn't list the articles anymore

*Please note:* The articles can still be searched using the Search button on the Help Center. Suggested articles don't work anymore.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Suggest articles don't appear on the Request Forms in next-gen projects

fields.description:
Problem:

By default, there is no option to set the resolution on the next-gen project service desk project.

Workaround:
To use A4J.
 !Screenshot 2021-02-25 at 1.18.39 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Expected behaviour :
To allow to set resolution in next-gen service desk project
fields.summary: Ability to set resolution  on JSM next gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
New issue view doesn't format Descriptions or Comments that include HTML stylesheets as expected.
The issue only affects new issue view. The old issue view in Jira displays the data correctly.
h3. Environment
Affects all the Jira products

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Best way to replicate the issue is by creating an issue by sending an email to the Mail handler.
The Email should contain HTML template.
Observe that the Description or comment added to the issue is not formatted/aligned as expected.

h3. Expected Results

 !image-2019-09-22-15-39-11-357.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Observe that the images are not aligned correctly.
 !image-2019-09-22-15-39-17-886.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Change the view to the old issue view.
fields.summary: New issue view doesn't format Descriptions or Comments that include HTML stylesheets as expected.

fields.description:
As of now, we can configure *Service Relationship* for a service.
However, if an Incident is raised for a Service, all the services under *Service Relationship* should be added to the *Impacted Service* field and also the *Incident* tag should be added to these services when viewing all services under the *Service* Tab.
fields.summary: Add services under "Service Relationship" to the "Impacted Services" when an Incident is reported for the Parent service.

fields.description:
In our usage of Jira Service Desk (currentlyg on Server, but soon to be migrated to Cloud) we need to set the default shared organization for customers belonging to more than one organization for new request.

Since many customers are on the same email domain, but in different departments, business, products etc, we cannot rely on the domain to accomplish this, but rather be able to set the default shared organization on a individual level.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of default sharing for new requests for customers being members to more than one organization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation rule condition "Affected services *is one of* x, y" does not get triggered when services x or y are chosen when creating an issue. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Go to Project Settings > Automation > Automation

 - Configure:
 *Trigger*: Issue created 
 - *Condition*: Issue fields condition:
 *Field:* Affected services, 
 *Condition:* is one of
 *Value:* choose two values 
 - *Action*: Send email
 - Rule doesn't work as expected even if we create the issues with the values

h3. Expected Results
The rule executes successfully for each value added.

h3. Actual Results

The execution shows "The following issues did not match the condition:" even when they did.

h3. Workaround

Use separate branches for each Affected Services value.
fields.summary: Automation condition "is one of" doesn't work for Affected Services field

fields.description:
If you mention any links in the '*Introduction Text*' box of the customer portal then you would notice that these links would always get opened on the new page.

This behavior is different from other areas of the customer portal. It would be helpful if these links get opened in the same tab as it happens for links mentioned in other places.

Please check the video attached below for reference.
fields.summary: links mentioned in 'Introduction Text' of customer portal should open in same tab

fields.description:
*Summary*

It happens regularly that a user locks his Windows-account by mistake, then creates a ticket and the admin have to unlock that user manually.

It will be nice when the ticket is created, Jira contacts the active directory and says: "hey someone is locked please unlock him"
fields.summary: Unlock Active directory user automatically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue reaches the approval stage and it is either approved or rejected then on the UI it remains in the approval status on the UI. A page refresh fixes this and the next status depending on the action taken is shown on the UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or choose an existing workflow with approval configured correctly.
 # Create a new issue.
 # Transition it to reach the approval stage.
 # Provide an approver and either approve or reject the request.

h3. Expected Results

The issue automatically transitions to the right status based on the action taken.
h3. Actual Results

The issue does not automatically transition (on the UI) to the right status based on the action taken. A page refresh is required.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The updated issue status does not automatically reflect on the UI after Approval or rejection

fields.description:
*Expected:*
Given an an IT Service Management JSM project and a couple of services (Operations) in the project, when API clients make a call to:
{code:html}
/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/{serviceDeskId}/requesttype/{requestTypeId}/field
{code}
then the client should have enough information to construct a valid service request.

*Actual:*
Currently, the API returns 
{code:json}
...
"validValues": []
...
{code}

When customers set Affected Services as a mandotory field, this prevents clients from being able to construct a valid service request.

*Suggested solution:*
The result can be more hypermedia oriented with an href element to a secondary endpoint that is the authority on assets. Of course, clients must expect to use the URL as a search, rather than a complete enumeration.
fields.summary: REST API clients need more metadata to deal with Affected Services

fields.description:
Currently, when you export the postmortem from Opsgenie to Confluence, it publishes along with the incident timeline that displays when viewing on the Confluence page.

However when you export the postmortem in Confluence to pdf, it displays the static heading for "Timeline", but it does not show the actual information.

As a customer, I would like the Opsgenie incident timeline information to be exportable in the pdf view in Confluence.
fields.summary: Export timeline information in Confluence postmortem to PDF.

fields.description:
Why not?

I run a platform support team that works as a division of engineering. Why do we need to handle issues in a separate project if we want to see development section? We should be able to see associated branches and pr's right in the service desk ticket.
fields.summary: Ability to view development section in service desk tickets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When formatting the Introduction text under *Project Setting -> Portal Setting* using [Text Formatting Notation|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] it does not load the first time we open the Help Center.
 If we open the Project portal and then navigate back it loads as expected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Jira Service Management Project go to *Project Setting -> Portal Setting* and add the Introduction Text and format it using [Text Formatting Notation|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all]
 # Open the Help Center, now we notice that the Introduction text that was added will not load

Recording: [^Screen Recording 2021-02-17 at 5.31.57 PM.mov]
h3. Expected Results

When opening the Help Center the formatted text should load.
h3. Actual Results

When opening the Help Center the formatted text does not load.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Portal Introduction formatted text not loading in the Help Center.

fields.description:
It's possible to see the number of views of each article added to the KB, but it's not possible to see who viewed the articles.
h3. Suggestion

Implement a view history for KB articles so admins can see which customers viewed each article.
fields.summary: History of article views in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding the *Team* field (from the *Advanced Roadmaps* feature) to a Request Form doesn't allow the user to select the *Preset Value*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Shared Team* in Advanced Roadmaps ([Managing shared teams|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/managing-shared-teams-802170492.html])
 # Create or Edit a *Request Type*
 # In its *Request Form*, add the Team field to Visible fields.
 ## After adding it, you will receive the following message: "_This field type cannot be shown - you must provide a preset value_."
 # Click in *Edit value*

h3. Expected Results

When editing the preset value, the Shared Team created in step 1 should've appeared to be selected.
h3. Actual Results

No dropdown field to select the Shared Team is showed, and you can only click on *Set* or *Cancel*

 !Screenshot_02-22 10.39.34_yImZw0.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
 # On the *Request Form* page
 # Click on the *Create* button on the navigation bar.
 # Select the *Request Type* you are editing.
 # In the *Team* field, select a Team and cancel the ticket creation.
 # Now click to edit the preset value of the Team field.
 # The dropdown field to select the Shared Team will correctly show all Teams available to be selected. 
 #* Recording: [^Workaround.mp4]
fields.summary: Adding the Team field to a Request Form doesn't allow the user to select the Preset Value for it

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, we can only link 50 assets to a single JSM issue
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to increase the limit to link more than 50 assets per issue
fields.summary: increase the limit to link more than 50 assets per issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At the moment, when admin editing the approval setting and update the "Include approvers from service" , it doesn't work for non ITSM project/workflow. Due to that , to caused confusion to the admin.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a non ITSM project
 # Create a ITSM project and choose the workflow scheme from non ITSM project to ITSM project
# Update the workflow approval configuration and able to set the "Include approvers from service"

h3. Expected Results
Non ITSM project workflow doesn't show the "Include approvers from service" section.

h3. Actual Results

Non ITSM project workflow show the "Include approvers from service" section.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When settings up Approval for non ITSM workflow , it show the Service approvals , which by default it will not work for non ITSM project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when the admin edited the existing ITSM workflow and use a workflow from non ITSM project , the service registry approval doesn't work.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admin to use a different workflow from a non ITSM project and shared to ITSM project. 
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Ability for Service Registry approval worked in ITSM project eventhough the workflow from a non ITSM project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to link more than 20 assets in a single Asset type field during the Edit operation

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue 
# Edit the issue and add try to add more than 20 assets to the "linked assets" field

h3. Expected Results
Able to link more than 20 assets 

h3. Actual Results
When you try to link the 21st asset, the following error is reported
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
On the Issue create action, you can add more than 20 assets to a single asset field 

h3. Workaround
Link the assets on the Create issue screen
fields.summary: Not able to link more than 20 assets in a single Asset type field during the Edit operation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We have different kind set of users who should raise in different projects and they should not see the other project. To give more context:
* Customers in Org A should raise a ticket in project A. Project A should not be seen by other customers
* The rest of customers can raise in other projects except project A. 

The problem now is that customer in Org A sometimes create tickets in project B (instead of project A), which something we don't want them to do.

h3. Suggested Solution
It'd be great to have the ability to create different links for projects so that they can be shared with the customers separately.
fields.summary: Ability to create different portal links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

“Assign to me” not showing when assigning tickets on the Queue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Unassigned issues queue on a Service project.
 # Click on the assignee field to assign an issue.

h3. Expected Results

It shows the option “Assign to me”.
h3. Actual Results

It shows the list of assignable users. When there are many agents, it will be necessary to search for your own name.
h3. Workaround

Click on the checkbox for the desired issue or issues, and then use the option “Assign” on the top or also, just check and uncheck the box that the option will appear as expected until the page is refreshed. 

!Screen Recording 2021-02-18 at 03.59.21 PM.gif|width=526,height=166!
fields.summary: Assign to me not showing when assigning tickets on the Queue

fields.description:
Are we able to use JQL queries within the queues that pull information from different projects?

 

For example we have 3 projects,  when a ticket comes in that hasn't been looked at it appears in a separate new queue for each project.

 

Would we be able to change it to have one queue that filters all tickets from all 3 projects in it
fields.summary: Are we able to use JQL queires within the queues that pull information from different projects
Agents should not be able to administer next-gen Jira Service Management project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching in user picker custom field from portal is slow (takes a few seconds) when it fetches from a lot of users (ie. 17k)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a few groups in User Management
 # Create 17k portal-user customers and migrate them to Atlassian account
 # Add those users to some of the groups
 # Create user picker custom field type
 # In custom field configuration, add those groups under "User Filtering"
 #*  !Screenshot 2021-02-18 at 9.16.58 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Associate this custom field in JSM project screen and show it in portal
 # Go to the portal and attempt to search for a user

h3. Expected Results

The search is fast enough to return those users
h3. Actual Results

It takes a few seconds (5-12 seconds) to return the result. The more keyword added will fasten the search but it's still slow.
h3. Notes
 * The user search is normal  (1-2 seconds) from Agent's view (ie. Create an issue by clicking "Create button")
 * It's only slow when we search from portal

h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Searching in user picker custom field from portal is slow

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

When Two rules are added in the Next-gen service project, there is no option to select what operations( AND or OR) these rules should implement.

Example: Transition issue to status XYZ if Priority is Highest or High.

When there are two conditions( Priority =Highest) and ( priority =High) are working as *AND* operations. No option to select how conditions should work ie OR operation or AND operation.

!Screenshot 2021-02-18 at 11.44.36 AM.png|width=339,height=186!

!Screenshot 2021-02-18 at 11.46.34 AM.png|width=338,height=136!
h3. Suggested solution

When they are two rules in the Next-gen service project provides the user option to select the operation (AND or OR) they want to implement.
h3. Why is it important

It allows users to have complex rules in Next-gen service projects.
fields.summary: Ability to choose what operations needs to performed when two rules are added in Next-gen service project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding layout columns to a KB page causes misalignment on the page at the portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page
# Add a title and text on the page
# Then add a layout columns
# Save the page and access the page at the portal

h3. Expected Results
The page loads just fine

h3. Actual Results
The page title and content are misaligned.
 !image-2021-02-17-18-10-49-754.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
On the Confluence side the page loads just fine.

h3. Workaround
Depending upon the business requirements you can use a table instead.
fields.summary: Adding layout columns to a KB page causes misalignment on the page at the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's currently not possible to see the incident timeline after exporting the postmortem from Opsgenie to Confluence. A blank page/field shows up under "Timeline" in Confluence
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new incident in Opsgenie
 # Resolve the incident
 # Create a postmortem report associated with that resolved incident
 # Export the postmortem to Confluence

h3. Expected Results

The incident timeline should appear under "Timeline" field in Confluence.
h3. Actual Results

No timeline entry shows up in Confluence after exporting the report from Opsgenie.
h3. Workaround

The incident timeline can be seen in the postmortem in Opsgenie.
fields.summary: Unable to see the incident timeline in Confluence report.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using a user as rule actor should defer to Automation for Jira as the actor when the user doesn't have access due to security restrictions isn't working - getting errors

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a rule and set the rule actor as a user without access to the ticket
 # Trigger the rule 

h3. Expected Results
The rule should be run with the actor Automation for Jira
h3. Actual Results
Rule gives an error


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using a user as rule actor isn't defering to the Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Moved ticket to ITSM project doesnt show in the specialised queues (Service Requests/Problems/Incidents/Changes)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a service request
 # Move to a different ITSM project

h3. Expected Results
The service request to show in the correct queue

h3. Actual Results
Service request doesn't show in the service request queue (only in general queue)
Description field box changes


h3. Workaround
Edit the Customer request type, to force it to be recognized.
fields.summary: Moved tickets to ITSM projects don't show on the specialised queues

fields.description:
As a service desk team lead, I would like to automatically assign new tickets to the engineer that's currently on-call according to Opsgenie.

 

A bit of background:

We recently decided to make use of the Opsgenie inclusion into Jira Service Management Cloud to create on-call schedules for our first-line engineers.

I've found a [community post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Opsgenie-questions/JSM-assigning-tickets-from-Opsgenie-on-call-callandar/qaq-p/1585950] suggesting a solution for the problem at hand, where a new ticket in the Service Desk created an Alert in Opsgenie. If the alert was ack'ed in Opsgenie, a comment would be made to the ticket Service Desk containing the username of the ack'ing user. A Service Desk automation rule would then run to assign the ticket to the username mentioned in the comment. It could work, but it would still require our engineers to interact with alerts in Opsgenie. We currently only use Opsgenie to administer the on-call schedule, and we don't need the full-fledged alerts management functionality it provides.
fields.summary: Auto-assign issues based on a Opsgenie On-call Schedule

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, after the admin remove the existing Microsoft email request at *Project Settings > Email Request* , it doesn't remove the email information in the database. Due to that, user unable to reconfigure the email using 3LO OAuth.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Microsoft email request using 3LO OAuth
 # Then , remove it from *Project Settings > Email Request*
# Then , reconfigure it

h3. Expected Results
Admin able to reconfigure it.

h3. Actual Results
Failed to reconfigure

From logs, it displays as below:-

{noformat}
Caused by: java.net.SocketException: Socket closed\n\tat java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:204)\n\tat java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:141)\n\tat sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketInputRecord.read(SSLSocketInputRecord.java:457)\n\tat sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketInputRecord.bytesInCompletePacket(SSLSocketInputRecord.java:68)\n\tat sun
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Support need to perform update from database. Please request Atlassian Support to perform the update.
fields.summary: Remove/Delete existing Microsoft custom email at Project settings doesn't delete the email information in database causing user failed to reconfigure email using 3LO OAuth

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a comment is added to an issue on Jira, a note is added to the related alert on Opsgenie. However, the note added could be hard to read due to not having the same renderer as a comment field in Jira. User mentions and attachment appears as inline text.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the readability of the notes by only adding plain text.
fields.summary: Improve notes look and feel in Opsgenie

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When a customer has set their profile language as something apart from English, some of the components like "request page" and Priority field are not translated
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your profile language to some other language than English
 # Make sure that you have added translation for priority field for that language under global admin page.

h3. Expected Results

_Everything on the customer portal should be displayed in that language along with the priority field value_
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-02-12-16-05-11-186.png|width=242,height=111!
 !Image 2021-02-12 at 4.04.58 PM.jpg|width=187,height=86!

 
h3. Workaround

No workaround available at the moment
h3. Notes

Even though while choosing the priority in the request form, we see the translated priority, after the request creation, it is displayed in English
fields.summary: Missing translations on Requests page and Priority field

fields.description:
h3. Update 25/6/21:

We are considering doing this in the coming months. Will update as soon as we know for sure about timing.

Liron Deutsch

Principal Product Manager

Jira Service Management
----
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Request Forms in Classic Service Projects have two fields that are available to be modified in a Single Line textbox: *Request form description* and *Request form help and instructions*:
 !Screenshot_02-11 17.14.30_l62FmQ.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Turn these fields into multi-line textboxes the same way they are in Next-Gen Service Projects:
 !Screenshot_02-11 17.14.54_92Nj3j.png|thumbnail!
h3. Why this is important

For admins, it is hard to type extensive instructions into a single-line textbox like these.
h3. Workaround

Type the instructions into a text editor software, then copy and paste to the fields.
fields.summary: Turn Request form fields description and instructions into Multi-Line textboxes

fields.description:
h3. Problem

On a ITSM project, it's possible to add the custom field Affected Services on the portal request form.

As stated on the [documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/add-or-remove-a-service-from-the-affected-services-field/], the field is only visible for licensed users.
h3. Suggestion

It would be great if, when adding the field to the form, a info or warning message to appear for the project administrator to know that only Jira users can view this field in the portal.
fields.summary: Show info message about Affected Services field when adding it on the request form

fields.description: Having integrated OpsGenie into Jira Service Management Cloud, access to OpsGenie features is an all or nothing arrangement for each project. We find there are cases where we don't want all JSM users on a project to have access to alerts and/or on-call. It would be very helpful if access to these features could be controlled at a user level in addition to the project level access currently provided.
fields.summary: Add Feature Access Control for Alerts and On-Call

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you try to enable email support in a project, an error is displayed and nothing else happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the *Project settings* > *Email requests*
 # Click on *Turn on email support*

h3. Expected Results
Email support will be enabled

h3. Actual Results
One of the errors below is displayed
{code}
Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0
{code}
{code}
JSON.parse: unexpected character at line 1 column 1 of the JSON data
{code}



h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Turning on email support throws JSON error

fields.description:
The outgoing way of Jira integrations(from Opsgenie to Jira) in Opsgenie currently add a public comment to an issue in Jira when an action such as acknowledge is taken in Opsgenie. 

As a customer, I would like to have the ability to add a private internal comment to issues for actions taken in Opsgenie.
fields.summary: Ability to add a private (internal) note in Jira ticket when action is taken in Opsgenie.

fields.description:
Jira customer notifications are sent to the customer in the language configured in customer profile (default language), they need to update their profile language to recieve notifications in the desired language.

Would be possible to send customer notifications based on "Request language" field rather than Customer configured language
fields.summary: JIRA customer notifications language based on Request language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary This bug was encountered when receiving an email from an external source into a service project that contained a long list of hashes, embedded in a table, after a dotted list is started. It appears to be a bug in parsing HTML to wikimarkup to ADF. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Step 1: Using a mail client that can send raw HTML (such as Thunderbird,Airmail etc. on Mac), send the following body to a service management project's email channel: {code:html}
*
###############################################################################
a
{code} h3. Expected Results The email should be rendered in the ticket body with the #'s as raw text. h3. Actual Results The email is rendered wrong, with the #'s converted into a deeply indented bulleted list: !image-2021-02-10-17-40-57-648.png|thumbnail! h3. Workaround Disabling HTML parsing from emails works around the issue but is a poor mitigation.
fields.summary: A sequence of # symbols in an email is converted into a bulleted list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At Legacy Automation, when users would like to set the JQL for "Issue Matches" condition using the basic JQL with a date picker custom field, it failed to update the time selection.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field using "Date Picker" type and add to JSM project screen
 # Open JSM project
# Go to *Legacy Automation*
# Create a new rule 
# At the *Condition* , choose *Issue Matches* condition
# Using the basic JQL , add the date picker field.
# Then , try to set 4 minutes oo 4 weeks , any selection and click *Update*
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-22 at 11.12.24 am.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
The JQL updated the selection

h3. Actual Results
The selection doesn't get updated and it still showing *All*

 !Screen Shot 2021-01-22 at 11.12.54 am.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Click *Switch to JQL* and update the JQL manually
fields.summary: Creating JQL for "Issue Matches" condition at legacy automation for "Date Picker" field , it doesn't update the time selection when using Basic JQL

fields.description:
As an admin, I would like to have the option to use an app account type to run actions like creating, updating, or commenting on an issue from an Opsgenie - JSM integration
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, you can only use a JSM licensed account for this integration:

!Screenshot_02-09 17.38.35_BtYc5B.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Give the admin the option to select an app account type (i.e., *Automation for Jira*, *Opsgenie Integration*) to run these actions.
h3. Why this is important

Using a real agent account for the integration may confuse the engineer working on the ticket, making him/her think another colleague is interacting with him/her and not Opsgenie.
h3. Workaround

Create a generic account will solve the problem, but it will cost the customers a JSM license.
fields.summary: Ability to use an app account type as an actor in Opsgenie - JSM integration actions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

False rule execution status displayed in Legacy automation rules
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Legacy Automation to update Request Type
 # Create a test ticket without Request Type
 # The rule executes successfully
 # The actions are performed on the issue but the logs show *{color:#ff0000}ERROR{color}*

h3. Expected Results

The logs show the correct execution STATUS(Whether it's ERROR/ EXECUTED)
h3. Actual Results

The rule is executed successfully but in the logs, it appears as an ERROR with message *The request type you are trying to view does not exist.*
*!2.PNG|thumbnail!*

The below error is seen on the console
{noformat}
{whens: [\{error: false, status: "SUCCESS", displayData: "Issue created"}
], ifThens: [\{,…}],…}

ifThens: [\{,…}]
0:  {,…}
ifConditions: [\{error: false, status: "SUCCESS", displayData: "Issue matches: "Customer Request Type" is EMPTY",…}]
0:  {error: false, status: "SUCCESS", displayData: "Issue matches: "Customer Request Type" is EMPTY",…}
thenActions: [\{error: false, status: "SUCCESS",…},…]
0:  {error: false, status: "SUCCESS",…}
1:  {error: false, status: "ERROR", displayData: "Edit request type: Incident (Jira / Confluence)",…}
displayData: "Edit request type: Incident (Jira / Confluence)"
displayHtml: "Edit request type name to "Incident (Jira / Confluence)""
error: false
outcomeMessage: "The request type you are trying to view does not exist."
status: "ERROR"
whenExecRecorded: true
whens: [\{error: false, status: "SUCCESS", displayData: "Issue created"}]
0:  {error: false, status: "SUCCESS", displayData: "Issue created"}
displayData: "Issue created"
error: false
status: "SUCCESS"
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: False errors logged in Legacy automation rules

fields.description:
Hi!

I would be interested in having a new feature implemented.

This feature would suggest articles in Confluence to customers, based on the info obtained from the request form

Unfortunately this functionality is not yet available in next-gen projects.

I wonder whether is expected to have this feature developed and when it could be available in next-gen projects

Best regards
fields.summary: Set up article suggestions in request forms

fields.description: As a customer, I would like to have the option to break the link between our Opsgenie instance and its associated cloud site, migrate it to another Atlassian site where we have our JSM subscription and merge this standalone Opsgenie with JSM at the end.
fields.summary: Ability to migrate Opsgenie instance to a cloud site where there is a JSM subscription.

fields.description: It would be nice if users could select *is one of* when using the *Affected services condition* in *Automation* as currently, users must either create multiple rules or a branched rule which takes far more time to setup and also requires a more complicated setup.
fields.summary: Ability to select "is one of" for the "Affected services condition" in Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If there are customer accounts added to a project that has proper Full Name instead of the email ID, do not appear in the search results in the Customer tab, when searching with a part of their email ID.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add few customers to a JSM project.
 # Make sure few accounts have Email address as their full name, and few accounts have a proper name as their full name.
 !image-2021-02-01-18-44-52-010.png! (/)
 !image-2021-02-01-18-20-31-238.png|thumbnail! (x)
 # Now if the user has email id *xxxxxx@gmail.com*, search *gmail* in the *Customer* tab.

h3.  Expected Results

If any Customer account added to a project has an email address with Gmail in it then that user should be shown in the result.
h3. Actual Results

Users who have edited their Full Name to a proper name is not shown in the search result.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Customers account do not appear in customer tab when searched with a part of their email.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

Currently, only licensed users can use the app for Jira Service Management projects.
h3. Proposed Solution:

Add this feature for JSM portal-only customers to be able to use the app to perform the below actions
 * Track the progress of my issues
 * Create new requests
 * Comment on my issues
 * Upload a photo of a defect
 * Search the knowledge base
fields.summary: Allow Jira Service management customers to use the Jira Cloud App

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We think it would be useful to have a field "updated by" to display, this would be useful as a quick reference

 

for example;

When a customer logs request and the service desk has requested more information, the updated by field would be a quick reference to see if the customer has responded with out having to go in to issue.




Regards,

Layla Tabaja

ACT Health Directorate.
fields.summary: Updated Field

fields.description:
Hi!

I would be interested in having a new feature implemented.

This feature would suggest articles in Confluence to customers, based on the info obtained from the request form

Unfortunately this functionality is not yet available in next-gen projects.

I wonder whether is expected to have this feature developed and when it could be available in next-gen projects

Best regards
fields.summary: Set up article suggestions in request forms

fields.description:
Breach notification are almost always used associated w/ SLAs, 'about to breach' and 'breached'. It seems logical that this would be incorporated directly into the SLA configuration screen. Something like this...

 
||When||Notify||Message||
|30m prior to breach|Assignee|issue.key is about to breach|
|Breached|Assignee, user123, GroupA|issue.key has breached|
fields.summary: As an Admin I would like to be able to configure 'breach' notifications directly w/in the SLA screen

fields.description: Today I have to go into my issues and search there. It would be great if a customer could search for an open issue in the main screen w/o having to click on Request > my open issues. The search needs to be able to find text in any text field, search by issue key, by reporter, etc.
fields.summary: As a customer I would like to be able to search for open issues directly from the help center search bar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Knowledge base articles are showing in Times New Roman for users in Europe. 

If the user is in Europe, but connects to a VPN in the US, for example, it works fine. 

The issue happens despite network, browser, OS.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Access an article in the customer portal or on Project > Knowledge base
 # It’s only possible to replicate if you are in Europe

h3. Expected Results

It shows the article in the sans-serif font

!Screen Shot 2021-02-04 at 11.20.19.png|width=472,height=513!
h3. Actual Results

The article’s content shows in Times New Roman

!image (6).png|width=603,height=476!
h3. Workaround

Connect to a VPN based on another location
fields.summary: Knowledge base articles are showing in Times New Roman for users in Europe

fields.description: It would be useful to have the option to disable the Opsgenie features/different sections of the queues(Service Request, Incident, Change, etc) in the ITSM template in the scenarios where the customer no longer wishes to use them.
fields.summary: Ability to disable features in the ITSM template

fields.description:
*Current Behaviour in New Issue View:*
 * Attachments are added in the comments when dragged and dropped into an issue.
 * To delete attachments, one has to edit the comment with which the attachment is added and remove it from there. This fires an 'edit comment' notification which is not necessary.

*Suggestion:*

The Attachments should be attached to the Attachments field without creating a new comment, like in the old issue view (or like in Jira Software projects with the new issue view), from where one can easily delete the attachment as needed.
fields.summary: Ability to upload/delete attachments to/from the Attachments field in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the Customer Portal, the *Requests* page allows admins to determine the fields to be displayed, however, there are no options to display custom fields and other system field , for example "Component" field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to display the custom fields available in the project.
fields.summary: Add the ability to display custom fields and other system field to the request page

fields.description:
Hi,

We would like to sync our AD with the request form on the customer portal. For example have custom fields like Name, contact, position, etc that auto populate into fields from AD. 

Currently we can set it up once the reporter completes a form and selects send it populates but we would like it to populate prior.

Thanks.
fields.summary: AD Sync on Request form

fields.description:
Some apps provide search capabilities showing request types and knowledgebase articles for the service desks that has been added to multiple sites. For both request types and knowledgebase articles, the app needs to make one API call per service desk added to the site:

GET /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/\{serviceDeskId}/knowledgebase/article
and
GET /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/\{serviceDeskId}/requesttype

This implementation has for example lead to this issue [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-618677] where one customer has hit the rate limit for at least one of those APIs. While there are API's to get all request types or knowledgebase articles, it would be preferable not to use them as this would yield excessive results and would necessitate filtering and potentially make more sequential REST calls to get any results that are meaningful to the app.

It would be ideal if it were possible to augment the GET /rest/servicedeskapi/requesttype API with a query parameter identifying the service desks IDs to retrieve results from.
fields.summary: Make it possible to get data for multiple service desks

fields.description:
*Current behavior:*

The New Issue View of Jira does not provide collapsing the Request Participants as the old issue view does.

*Suggestion:*

It would be great to have the feature of collapsing the Request Participants in the New Issue View as well.
fields.summary: Ability to collapse Request Participants in New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the subscribed Opsgenie is a subordinated version of the JSM subscription, all the data traffic from this Opsgenie should be allowed even when the [IP allowlist feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/ip-allowlisting-998658750.html] has been enabled.

In the current design, the [Opsgenie outbound IP list|https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/opsgenie-ip-adress-list] isn't whitelisted automatically when this feature is enabled on the JSM side and this list contains over 60 addresses required for adding, which might not be a great practice. This then stops the JSM integration data from Opsgenie to the JSM project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a JSM Premium project with a subordinate Opsgenie instance.
 # Configure the JSM integration on this Opsgenie instance.
Documentation -> [https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/jiraservicedesk-integration]
 # Enable the IP Allowlist feature on the JSM project without adding the Opsgenie outbound IP list.
 # Fire test alerts on the Opsgenie instance to verify if an issue will be created on the JSM project.

h3. Expected Results

The Opsgenie Outbound IP List should be added automatically when the IP Allowlist feature is enabled and all integration data should be sent from Opsgenie to JSM flawlessly.
h3. Actual Results

The Opsgenie OutBound IP List isn't on the allowlist, leading the JSM integration data is rejected with the following response body from the JSM side.

!image-2021-02-03-11-17-17-899.png|width=649,height=28!
h3. Workaround

Currently, we can only add all of the Outbound IP List and [Atlassian Cloud IP Ranges|https://ip-ranges.atlassian.com/] which takes up over 60 entries on the allowlist, not very ideal and no room for setting up other IP entries on the list.
fields.summary: Auto whitelist OG outbound IP list when the IP allowlist feature is enabled on JSM

fields.description:
When using a Confluence Space as a Knowledge Base for a JSM project, it's possible to [define permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/manage-knowledge-base-permissions-from-your-service-project/], to specify who can view the article. One of the available options is *Public*, which will enable Anonymous Access on Confluence side (on the Global Permissions, and also on the desired Space Permissions). 

However, in case the Confluence Instance has [IP Allowlist|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/ip-allowlisting-998658750.html] in place, enabling *Public* access on JSM won't make the articles accessible by *everyone*, as the *IP limitation will still be in place.* 

This is *the expected behavior*, however, it would be good if this was prompted for JSM admins, so they can take into account this limitation, and re-consider if this would be the best way to configure the integration.
h3. Proposed Solution

Notify a user when using the *Public* permission on a Knowledge Base in case Confluence has an IP Allowlist configuration in place.
fields.summary: Notify JSM admins if Confluence has an IP Allowlist in place when enabling Public access on the Knowledge Base

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to see "Sub-task Progress" (as displayed in the sub-task table on the Task page - i.e., the percentage of completed sub-tasks, along with a green/red bar) in the "Queue Navigator".

So Sub-task progress would need to be available as a selectable column.
fields.summary: Make "Sub-task Progress" available as a column in Queue Navigator

fields.description:
This is something that was tested by one community leader.

Basically, you can invite one user to a customer portal. Let's say that the user received invitation but didn't accept it yet and didn't create an account on the portal.

It seems that agents can still assign invited user to a created request or even tag him/her in the comments section. Even if the user didn't register but just received invitation, he/she will still be notified via e-mail about changes made on the issue or mentions in the comments.

I guess this could be a potential problem if let's say, user doesn't want to accept invitation, or if agent sent an invitation to a wrong e-mail.
fields.summary: Preventing spams

fields.description:
This is somewhat related to the JSDCLOUD-9684.

So, as there is currently no way to determine if the invited customer registered/created an account or not, it would maybe be beneficial for Service desk users to know which user is invited but still didn't register.

This could be in a way that in the _Customer_ list inside the project, next to a customer name, we have a status (a.k.a. 'flag') for example _Invitation sent_ or something like this - just an information for operators to know that invited user didn't register yet.
fields.summary: Flagging invited customers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Third-party add-on displaying full Space hierarchy content on the Knowledge Base

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install third-party add-on
 # Add a macro from the add-on to a page
 # Access that page on the Knowledge Base
 # Click the macro

h3. Expected Results
You're redirected to the linked page on the macro

h3. Actual Results
The KB will display a full view of the Space, as if accessing on Confluence directly

*Note:* This is replicable with [Refined Toolkit for Confluence Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216056/refined-toolkit-for-confluence-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Third-party add-on displaying full Space hierarchy content on the Knowledge Base

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition:

Currently, we have to manually export the report results into CSV file. The only possible way to automate this is via Filter Subscriptions
h3. Suggested Solution:

Provide something similar to Filter Subscriptions with JSM reports
fields.summary: Ability to automate the export of JSM reports

fields.description:
When the end user send email from their gamil or mail, the ticket status in JIRA changes but the content is not seen via., JIRA. The same content is visible only via., email. 

Similarly when we send comments via., JIRA to the End-user's email, the contents is not visble to the user. It appears as a blank message with no content. At times mail is not sent. We are not receiving any not delivered message as a notification.
fields.summary: Does the jira titcket support the other mail services?

fields.description:
Currently when a customer account user is migrated from a customer account to an Atlassian account, the customer account is deactivated rather than removed. 

This causes problems when the user is then removed from Atlassian account and tries to sign up for an account, which they cannot as they still have an deactivated account in customer account.
fields.summary: Migrating a customer account to atlassian account do not remove the old account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an email is generated that contains a "<" character the resulting email shows correct contents in the HTML version but the text version content is truncated at the first < character.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter a comment with the "<" character.
 # Check the resulting email both in the HTML and the text versions.

h3. Expected Results
* Both HTML and text versions should contain the correct contents.

h3. Actual Results
* The HTML version shows correct contents but in the text version, the content is truncated at the first < character.

h3. Workaround
Use the HTML version.
fields.summary: In text version notification, content is truncated at the first < character

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a ticket is re-assigned using issue view, the new assignee is not reflected on the queues page. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a JSM queue
 # Open a ticket from the queue, in another tab, and assign the ticket to user 1
 # Confirm if the queue is displaying user 1 as assignee
 # Go to the ticket and change the assignee from user 1 to user 2 (can't be from  user 1 to unassigned)

h3. Expected Results

After around 10s the user 2 should be displayed at the queue as assignee, without needing to refresh the page.

h3. Actual Results

The user 1 name and avatar is still displayed, instead of user 2. If you hover over the user 1 information you'll see the details of user 2.

 !bug.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

- Reload queues page to see correct assignee value

- Click on the stale Assignee field and UI will show the latest assignee
fields.summary: Re-assigning an issue displays the incorrect assignee on the queue page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Currently, only Jira fields can be used fetched in JQL and used in JSM reports. With the user of AWS connector, we would like to extend the JSM reports to use fields such as Account ID, Region name, status etc.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a feature to fetch the AWS connector field values and use them in JSM reports
fields.summary: Ability to use AWS connector fields in Jira Service Management reports

fields.description: When a customer has multiple requests open at the same time it can become difficult to manage them by open every request separately. Instead it would be helpful when clicking on a request that the request discussion opens directly underneath the ticket line in a scroll down, giving the customer the ability to directly answer on the requests page. To provide users with the ability to change that according to their preferences, the design configuration (normal design vs. suggested design) should be configurable by the user itself. By default the normal design (clicking on a ticket opens the request in the browser page) should be enabled.
fields.summary: Open request discussion directly on requests page

fields.description: Regarding GDPR requirements it would be necessery to allow new users to read privacy information before registering and creating account. Registration form should have option to include custom link to privacy information.
fields.summary: Allow customer to view privacy information without registering

fields.description:
*Problem Definition:*
When a customer sends a request via email channel with attachments, they are shown in Attachments as well as in the comments section of the Agent issue view.

*Suggested Idea:*
Ability to hide the attachments from the comments in Agent issue view when the request is created via email channel with attachments.
fields.summary: Ability to hide the attachments from the comments when the Request is created via email channel

fields.description:
*Problem Definition:*
Even if there are more than 25 Request Types in multiple projects for a customer, he will be able to see not more than 24 Request Types in the filter as shown below:

 !image-2021-01-31-09-12-26-131.png|thumbnail! 

*How to reproduce:*

* Give access to the customer of more than 3 projects.
* Make sure that all the projects have more than 10 Request Types.
* Now, go to the Help Centre as a customer and select *Requests -> Created by me*
* In the last filter of Request Type, maximum 23 to 24 Request Types will be shown in the drop-down.

*Suggested Idea:*

It would be great to have the ability to see all the Request Types of the projects that the customer has access to.
fields.summary: Ability to show more than 24 Request Types in the filter in the customer as access to more than 3 Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

An agent is able to select assets assigned to different customers from the Jira application
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight asset field using the option to Assign Object in the Asset Type Configuration [How to assign Insight assets to Jira Service Desk users|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSCLOUD/How+to+assign+Insight+assets+to+Jira+Service+Desk+users]
 # Create 4 assets A, B, X, and Y
 # Assign them to customers as follows: Customer1: A, B Customer2: X, Y
 # Login as customer1 to raise the request from the portal, the customer can only browse and select the assets assigned to the customer A and B (or unassigned assets if any)
 # Now login as an agent and try to raise a request on behalf of the Customer1 from Jira application

h3. Expected Results

The agent should not be able to raise a request with an asset that is assigned to another customer, in this case for customer1, the agent should not be able to choose assets X and Y
h3. Actual Results

The agent is able to create a request on behalf of the customer1 from the Jira application with assets X or Y assigned to a different customer
h3. Workaround

As a workaround for now, if JSM agents need to raise a request on behalf of the customer, they should do it from the portal: 
 # From your service project, go to *Raise a request*.
 # Find the request form that fits your customer's request.
 # In the *Raise this request on behalf of* field, find the customer using the dropdown or enter the customer's email address.
 # Fill out the request details and click *Send*.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: An agent is able to select assets assigned to different customers from the Jira application
